alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 9:58AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream and slot canyon flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring within Zion National Park. * WHERE...Zion National Park in southern Utah, including the following counties, Iron, Kane and Washington. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff, and are not expected to peak until overnight tonight. Flow are expected to diminish into Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 956 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Zion National Park reported high flows and waterfalls in normally dry areas. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Fork Virgin River, Clear Creek, Timber Creek, La Verkin Creek, Dry Creek, Currant Creek, Right Fork North Creek, Little Creek, Locust Creek, North Creek, Shunes Creek, Virgin River, Blue Creek, Ash Creek, Taylor Creek, Kolob Creek and North Fork Virgin River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Zion National Park, Springdale, Rockville and Kolob Canyon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
